data.enText: a feeling that you get when sth affects your body

data.chText: 我有一种坠落的感觉，像在梦中似的。
data.enText: I had a sensation of falling, as if in a dream.
the ability to feel through your sense of touch

data.chText: 她的两条胳膊好像完全失去知觉了。
data.enText: She seemed to have lost all sensation in her arms.

data.chText: 直觉；莫名其妙的感觉；经历；回忆
data.enText: a general feeling or impression that is difficult to explain; an experience or a memory

data.chText: 他不安地感到有人在监视他。
data.enText: He had the eerie sensation of being watched.

data.chText: 我到那儿后，感觉到她一直在等着我。
data.enText: When I arrived, I had the sensation that she had been expecting me.

data.chText: 轰动；哗然；引起轰动的人（或事物）
data.enText: very great surprise, excitement, or interest among a lot of people; the person or the thing that causes this surprise

data.chText: 他被捕的消息引起了轰动。
data.enText: News of his arrest caused a sensation .

data.chText: 一夜之间，这支乐队名声大振。
data.enText: The band became a sensation overnight.

ex.chText: 教授激动地谈起哲学的重要性。
ex.enText: The professor spoke with considerable passion about the importance of philosophy.

ex.chText: 最近一些食品问题已激起人们强烈的情绪。
ex.enText: Recent food issues have aroused strong passions.

ex.chText: 我的朋友酷爱英国文学。
ex.enText: My friend has a passion for British literature.

ex.chText: 诗人表达了他对心仪的姑娘火一般的爱恋之情。
ex.enText: The poet expressed his burning passion for the girl he loved.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的感情或对某事物的狂热爱好；也指两性间强烈的爱情或肉欲。

ex.chText: 他对这一裁定无动于衷。
ex.enText: He showed no emotion at the verdict.

ex.chText: 在朋友面前，她从来不掩饰自己的情感。
ex.enText: She never hides her emotions in front of her friends.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的情感或情绪，如爱、恨、恐惧 、愤怒等。

ex.enText: I've got a feeling of hunger.

ex.chText: 他从不顾及他人的感受。
ex.enText: He never cares about the feelings of others.

ex.chText: 她的感情受到了严重的伤害。
作为一名成年人，你应该学会顾及他人的感情。
ex.enText: As an adult, you should learn to be considerate of other people's feelings.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指内心和感官的感受；也指相对思想观念而言的情感，作此义解时通常用复数。

ex.chText: 这是一种奇怪的感觉——她觉得他们以前曾经很亲密。
ex.enText: It was a strange sensation - she felt they used to be close with each other.

ex.chText: 他左手突然有种灼热的感觉。
ex.enText: Suddenly, he had a burning sensation in his left hand.

synonyms.bx: 指由某一事件、经历或记忆引起的难以描述的感受；也指感官的感觉，尤指触觉。

tr: the faculty through which the external world is apprehended
example: in the dark he had to depend on touch and on his senses of smell and hearing

tr: an unelaborated elementary awareness of stimulation
a general feeling of excitement and heightened interest
example: anticipation produced in me a sensation somewhere between hope and fear

tr: someone who is dazzlingly skilled in any field
a state of widespread public excitement and interest

example.ex: Floating can be a very pleasant sensation...
example.tran: 漂浮会是一种非常惬意的感觉。

example.ex: A sensation of burning or tingling may be experienced in the hands.
example.tran: 双手可能会有种刺痛感或灼热感。

value.def: Sensation is your ability to feel things physically, especially through your sense of touch.

example.ex: The pain was so bad that she lost all sensation.
example.tran: 太疼了，疼得她都失去了知觉。

example.ex: ...nerve damage which can lead to loss of sensation in the limbs.
example.tran: 会导致四肢麻木的神经损伤

value.def: You can use sensation to refer to the general feeling or impression caused by a particular experience.

example.ex: It's a funny sensation to know someone's talking about you in a language you don't understand.
example.tran: 知道有人正用一种你听不懂的语言谈论你，这种感觉很奇怪。

value.tran: (某种经历所产生的)整体感觉，总体印象

value.def: If a person, event, or situation is a sensation, it causes great excitement or interest.

example.ex: ...the film that turned her into an overnight sensation.
example.tran: 使她一夜间名声大噪的影片

value.tran: 引起轰动的人(或事件、情况)

value.def: If a person, event, or situation causes a sensation, they cause great interest or excitement.

example.ex: She was just 14 when she caused a sensation at the Montreal Olympics.
example.tran: 她在蒙特利尔奥运会上引起轰动时才 14 岁。
